title: Colombian beer 90s
content:
Carefully check the amplitude of the letter 'O', the termination of the letter 'R' and the shape of the letter 'E'

author: FigoGalactic

comments.content:
I'm almost certain this is custom drawn, but these come close:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/chipping/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140910005806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/chipping/regular/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/chipping/regular/") (more for LEONA, not so much for CERVEZA)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/beaufort/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140910005806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/beaufort/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/beaufort/")  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/berthold/laudatio-bq/volume](http://web.archive.org/web/20140910005806/http:/www.fonts.com/font/berthold/laudatio-bq/volume "http://www.fonts.com/font/berthold/laudatio-bq/volume") (medium weight)

Perhaps the closest out of the box tiny/spur serif fonts to this lettering are:  
Mythica [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/mythica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140910005806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/mythica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/k-type/mythica/") Even has a similar convex curve to the leg on the \_R\_ Has several weights to handle the different versions sof the lettering.  
Modesto [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140910005806/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto/") Note the close \_E\_. Several widths and weights.  
Don
